snippet: Former President Bill Clinton drew sharp lines between the choices voters face, using the economic successes in his presidency as a case for re-electing President Obama.
abstract: Former President Bill Clinton and President Obama hug onstage after Clinton delivers an impassioned plea on behalf of Obama’s re-election; former president nominates Obama to a second term with a forceful and spirited argument that Democratic values will restore the promise of the middle class.

byline.original: By JEFF ZELENY and MARK LANDLER

lead_paragraph: Former President Bill Clinton drew sharp lines between the choices voters face, using the economic successes in his presidency as a case for re-electing President Obama.

headline.seo: Bill Clinton Urges a Second Term for Obama
headline.main: Clinton Delivers Impassioned Plea for Obama Second Term
headline.print_headline: Clinton Delivers Stirring Plea for Obama Second Term
headline.sub: A Stinging Rebuttal to G.O.P.’s Plan Caps Night of Appeals
